He wears a crown fashioned from the broken weapons of those who have challenged him to claim his position. Positioned beneath the shelter of the overhanging gnomon stone, Jarl Thrawn's throne symbolically upholds the weight of the stone, safeguarding the people of Vatha. To the knights and nobles within the court, Vatha and its sovereign serve as a poignant reminder of the righteous employment of strength: the protection of those who are weaker than oneself.

content.title: Edom
paragraphs: Edom was constructed in the naturally freezing northeastern region, which is not an ideal location for anyone except the Nords. However, the warmth emitted by the volcanoes in these icy lands enticed and offered solace to the Changelings who established this city. It also served as a refuge from external threats, thanks to the encircling mountains that effectively kept the dangerously close Voidborns and their accompanying corruption at bay. Edom's foundation was laid at the base of a prominent mountain called Ironhold, with the city sprawling outward into the valley and beyond. While the term 'Edom'  refers to the entire encompassing free city, its central castle, often referred to as the 'place of the thrill' by Edomites, is officially recognized as the Rising Ash.

The Rising Ash comprises a vast array of competition arenas, training facilities, and spectator seating under the ownership of the UnA (United Alliance). It serves as the perpetual host of an ongoing tournament that showcases a diverse range of martial skills, including jousting, wrestling, horseback melee, one-on-one combat, archery, and more. Renowned throughout the Trident, this cherished venue attracts knights and aspiring contenders from all three cities, offering them an opportunity to gauge their abilities against formidable opponents. Participation is open to all those brave enough to step forward.

content.title: Bravery
paragraphs: The knights of Edom firmly uphold bravery as the utmost virtue, recognizing that genuine virtue cannot exist without bravery. They understand that without courage, individuals would never venture into uncharted territory or endeavor to enhance their skills. Yet, armed with bravery in their hearts, they view no challenge as insurmountable.

In the pursuit of valor, fear and cowardice are considered adversaries by the knights of Edom. They dedicate themselves to conquering their own fears. While they acknowledge that complete liberation from fear is unattainable, they impart the wisdom that fear is a valuable tool. They advocate for harnessing fear as a catalyst for achievement, distinguishing true bravery from mere recklessness. The knights of Edom frequently reference the words of Indreon, the first knight of Ironhold, who proclaimed, “Fear is the herald of valor that designates the adversary fit for the lance's fatal embrace.”

Edom’s knights pursue a feeling called the Thrill by Edomites that can be gotten in battle or in any daunting and overtly challenging task. This high and the overcoming of the obstacle that causes it is seen as one of the most “tangible” rewards for bravery among them and many live their lives in constant pursuit of the Thrill.

content.title: Edom's UnA Knights
paragraphs: Renowned for their unwavering optimism, the knights of Edom exude an unwavering certainty in their ability to triumph against any obstacle, so long as they confront it head-on. With their convivial nature and unwavering self-assurance, they eagerly embrace novel experiences, even though their own lifespans tend to be relatively brief as a result.  They constantly tow the thin line between valor and foolishness in the eyes of other people, especially those used to Caliburn's society and perception of things. As a testament to their bravery, these knights eschew the use of shields, instead adorning their armor with the shattered remnants of their vanquished foes' defenses.

Attracted to the most dangerous of quests all the time, Edom's knights ardently believe that the most daunting challenges are the ones truly worth surmounting. It is in facing supernatural perils that would quell weaker spirits that they truly excel, and as a result, they eagerly fill the ranks of the UnA and willingly provide numbers of knights and spellswords that embark on the campaigns to push back the encroaching Voidbringers. Amidst their endeavors to vanquish monstrous threats, they also go on personal odysseys to conquer their deepest fears. One knight may seek to vanquish a creature that frightened them as children, another to avenge their mother's being taken by a monster, or yet another to challenge the colossal giant who hurt their beloved (or just a Nord who was an asshole).

content.title: Ironhold
paragraphs: The Rising Ash stands nestled beside the scorching Ironhold, a colossal mountain pulsating with volcanic fervor. To earn the esteemed title of an Edomite knight, a hopeful must confront the phobomantic illusionary dread that arises from the rock's searing surface, plunging their blade into its fiery core. If their mettle prevails and they are brave, they can withdraw their weapon, but should fear or cowardice impede them, the sword remains ensnared in the clutches of Ironhold.

Edomite lore speaks of Ironhold's clandestine whispers, audible solely to the aspiring knights, often taunting and jeering as a litmus test of their courage. Legend credits this taunting as the catalyst that inspired Indreon to be the first to impale the stone with her sword. There is a myth that on rare occasions, when Ironhold deems a knight exceptionally worthy, it endows their weapon with an immortal boon, forever infusing it with its own mystical prowess. This has never happened, however.

content.title: Rule
paragraphs: Instead of a sole ruler, Edom is governed by a ruling council comprised of knights and members of the noble class. The council's ambassador is chosen through democratic means, with the city's residents voting for their preferred candidate. However, despite this democratic structure, political tension, including racial and social class issues, pervades Edom, much like the other Trident cities.

The nobility, in particular, is known for their hot-headedness and intense emotions, which is evident in the frequency of personal conflicts that are taken outside of the Rising Ash. Even minor disputes among the nobility are settled through competitions or combat. These contests rarely result in death, and all participants accept the outcome as the final resolution of their disagreements. Consequently, grudges are short-lived, and the council can conduct its business with a degree of civility.

content.title: Azisi's Spiral
paragraphs: Azisi's Spiral is a treacherous floating island located northwest of Edenfell. It got its name by being the fast-spinning, precariously deathly location of a battle against a Voidbringer nest and the powerful Voidbringer the UnA have christened Azisi. Suspended hundreds of feet above Ocean Titane and the Boiling Lake, the island's relentless rotation creates a hazardous environment, making it incredibly dangerous for anyone to venture too close. Anything that the spiral drops into the Boiling Lake is often consumed without a trace. The island is not a known site of Voidborn activity and the whereabouts of Azisi are unknown, but the UnA faced significant challenges in their attempts to confront Azisi and neutralize the Voidbringer's threat because the island's unstable nature and the destructive power of the Boiling Lake tested their courage and resourcefulness, as such the name has stuck.

content.title: The Red Woods
paragraphs: Deep in the heart of the land lies the Red Woods, a haunting place where time seems to stop and nature's vitality has been paused. Here, old trees reach towards the sky with their twisted branches, their canopy thick and lush, but with no new growth. In this forever twilight realm, the Red Woods stands as a solemn reminder of past battles and lives lost.

Once a site of fierce confrontation between Durlan's Higher Sentient and the encroaching forces of darkness, the Red Woods bear the scars of that tumultuous conflict. The ground, tainted by the blood of fallen heroes, remains a poignant reminder of the sacrifices made in the name of protection. Moss-clad trunks and twisted roots intertwine, creating a somber tapestry that tells the tale of valor and loss.

content.title: Woden's Hill
paragraphs: At the border between the Red Woods and Woden's Marsh, a mysterious monolith stands tall. Its surface bears the engraved word 'tenacity', representing the fifth core virtue of Edenfell. Though the Monolith doesn't possess any proven or discernible powers, it has an intriguing history. During a seemingly hopeless battle between the Higher Sentient and the Voidborns, victory was claimed only after the Sentient was driven into a corner, with their backs against the wall—quite literally, as the wall they found strength from was the Monolith. The Monolith became a symbol of renewed vigor and inner unity, enabling the Sentient to overcome adversity.

Similar stories have emerged over time, recounting settlers fleeing from the Voidbringers or lost and drained of stamina, finding a surge of energy and determination when near the Monolith. However, these accounts remain unverified, as no tangible evidence has supported the claims. People who have sought to test these stories at the Monolith have experienced nothing out of the ordinary. Thus, these tales are often dismissed as mere coincidence, fabrication, or exaggeration. Nevertheless, the enigmatic presence of the Monolith continues to capture the imagination of those who encounter it, leaving them to ponder the possibility of hidden forces at play or the significance of the human spirit in the face of adversity.

content.title: Sorceror's Graveyard
paragraphs: Once a site of fierce confrontation between Durlan's Higher Sentient and the encroaching forces of darkness, the Red Woods bear the scars of that tumultuous conflict. The ground, tainted by the blood of fallen heroes, remains a poignant reminder of the sacrifices made in the name of protection. Moss-clad trunks and twisted roots intertwine, creating a somber tapestry that tells the tale of valor and loss.

Within this forsaken sanctuary, no traditional tombstones mark the fallen. Instead, the ancient trees themselves serve as silent sentinels, bearing the weight of memory and homage. Visitors are rare, for the Red Woods still harbor hidden dangers and remnants of evil that linger. It is a place of solitude and contemplation, where the spirits of the fallen find solace amidst the ancient giants. The Red Woods stands as a testament to the everlasting sacrifice and unwavering courage, their silent presence a tribute to the battles fought and the souls lost within their shadowed depths.

paragraphs.text: Devil's Workshop, a mysterious floating island near Edom, has recently gained notoriety due to an enigmatic incident involving

. The island had long remained unnamed and relatively untouched by the looming threat of the Voidbringers. However, a sighting of a peculiar creature, rumored to be a Cherub, near Caliburn led to speculation that it sought refuge on the secluded island once the battle had concluded. This event sparked curiosity and intrigue, and the island was subsequently christened Devil's Workshop due to the unknown and suspicious activities taking place there.

content.title: UnA Stronghold
paragraphs: The UnA Stronghold, nestled in the majestic valley of Edenfell's northernmost mountains, serves as the impregnable headquarters of the United Army. It stands as a bastion of strength and resilience, a symbol of the unwavering commitment to defend the Trident and repel the relentless advances of the Voidbringers and Higher Sentient. This state-of-the-art fortress is equipped with the finest facilities, meticulously designed to support and nurture the warriors who stand as the shield between Edenfell and the encroaching darkness.

Within the UnA Stronghold, every detail has been carefully considered to ensure the utmost efficiency and functionality. The armory is a sight to behold, lined with rows upon rows of gleaming weapons, meticulously crafted by master artisans. From the sharpest blades to the most intricate enchanted armaments, the armory leaves no room for compromise in the pursuit of excellence.

content.title: UnA Stronghold Fortress
paragraphs: Within the UnA Stronghold Fortress, every detail has been carefully considered to ensure the utmost efficiency and functionality. The armory is a sight to behold, lined with rows upon rows of gleaming weapons, meticulously crafted by master artisans. From the sharpest blades to the most intricate enchanted armaments, the armory leaves no room for compromise in the pursuit of excellence.

content.title: Quarters
paragraphs: Adjacent to the armory lies the barracks, a sprawling complex that houses and trains the diverse array of swordsmen, warriors, and mages who have dedicated their lives to the great duty of protecting Edenfell. The barracks provide a home away from home for the soldiers, with comfortable quarters, training grounds, and sparring arenas where combat skills are honed to perfection.

content.title: The Grand Library
paragraphs: In addition to its functional aspects, the UnA Stronghold also boasts a rich infrastructure of knowledge and education. The Grand Library within its walls houses an extensive collection of ancient tomes, grimoires, and scrolls, providing a wealth of arcane knowledge to the mages and spellcasters who seek to deepen their understanding of the forces they wield. Scholars and strategists convene in dedicated chambers, analyzing maps, deciphering prophecies, and formulating battle plans to counter the ever-evolving threats faced by Edenfell.

content.title: The Workshop
paragraphs: The Stronghold also serves as a center for innovation and research. Within its workshops, master craftsmen and alchemists collaborate to develop new weapons and protective gear, pushing the boundaries of what is possible. State-of-the-art laboratories hum with activity as alchemists experiment with rare components and enchanters weave powerful spells into the very fabric of the warriors' equipment. The UnA Stronghold serves as a beacon of progress, where ancient traditions intertwine with cutting-edge technologies to create a formidable fighting force.
This is where relics are requested and purchased.

content.title: Training Grounds
paragraphs: Amidst the steel and stone, the heart of the UnA Stronghold lies in the camaraderie and resilience of its inhabitants. The warriors who call this fortress their home forge unbreakable bonds united in their purpose and shared commitment. The training grounds echo with the clashing of swords and the crackling of magic as seasoned veterans impart their wisdom to the next generation of defenders. Here, the spirit of honor, duty, and sacrifice is nurtured, ensuring that those who emerge from the UnA Stronghold are not only skilled warriors but also embody the very essence of unwavering resolve.

content.title: Woden's Marsh
paragraphs: Woden's Marsh, located west of Edenfell, is a marshland where the corrupting influence of Nimiane holds its most potent sway, second only to Obscuron. Situated between Ocean Titane to the west, which still supports some forms of life, and the Dead Ocean to the east, completely consumed by corruption, Woden's Marsh is an unforgiving place where survival is measured in a matter of hours or even minutes. The marsh is infested with the strongest Voidborn creatures and their numerous hordes, making it a hotbed of danger. The corruption in the air and nature is overwhelming, draining the very essence of life itself. It stands as a perilous expanse, highly fatal and fraught with hazards. Venturing into Woden's Marsh is not just a suicidal act, but almost a guaranteed death sentence for all but the most supernaturally gifted or powerful individuals in Edenfell. Only the resilient bayou bears manage to survive in this inhospitable environment, likely by remaining submerged in the murky swamp water for extended periods and adapting to the harsh conditions. However, even they prefer other swamplands, including those close to the Kai Wings who prey on them, over this treacherous marsh.

content.title: Werewick
paragraphs: Werewick, located west of Edenfell, is a region abundant with extensive ruins from the old world. These ruins constantly attract the attention of the UnA scouts and Lorechasers, who are dedicated to discovering and excavating the remnants of the past. The area is characterized by precarious highlands and towering mountains, their snow-covered peaks reaching toward the sky. At the heart of this highland range lies the Tigron Cliffs, a ring of the tallest peaks in Edenfell, surrounded by other impressive mountains and the winding river valleys that flow between them.

While Werewick falls within the danger zone influenced by the corruption of the Voidborns, it is not as severely affected as places like Woden's Marsh or the Red Woods. The uneven terrain of the highland, coupled with the vigilant efforts of Caliburn's UnA scouts, helps to mitigate the spread of corruption. Despite the inherent risks, the allure of the ancient ruins and the potential knowledge they hold drive the UnA scouts and Lorechasers to explore the area, unearthing fragments of history and piecing together the story of the old world. Werewick tests the resilience and determination of those who seek to unravel the mysteries of the past, even in the face of darkness and danger.

content.title: Guinevere's Conquest
paragraphs: Guinevere's Conquest stands as a testament to the unwavering determination and indomitable spirit of the Nordic General Guinevere de la Fontaine, the extraordinary spellsword who led the UnA to their greatest victory. This floating island, situated in the northern region of Edenfell, had long been plagued by the relentless onslaught of the Voidborn, dark creatures born of corruption and chaos. However, under Guinevere's exceptional leadership, the UnA forces united and launched a monumental campaign to reclaim the island and purge it of the malevolent presence that had plagued it for centuries.

The battle that unfolded on Guinevere's Conquest was a grueling and harrowing affair, as the UnA faced off against the massed ranks of the Voidborn. The air crackled with magic as Guinevere, wielding her enchanted blade and commanding powerful spells, led her troops fearlessly into the heart of the enemy's stronghold. With strategic brilliance and unparalleled combat prowess, she inspired her soldiers to fight with unwavering resolve, rallying them even in the face of overwhelming odds. The clash of steel and the eruption of spells echoed throughout the island as the UnA forces pushed back the Voidborn, inch by hard-fought inch.

With the Voidborn vanquished and the island freed from their malevolent influence, Guinevere's Conquest earned its name as a tribute to the extraordinary deeds of General Guinevere and the UnA forces. The victory marked a turning point in the war against the Voidborn, inspiring hope and renewing faith in the struggle against the forces of corruption. Guinevere's leadership and prowess as a spellsword became legendary, and her name became synonymous with courage and unwavering determination. Guinevere's Conquest stands as a symbol of triumph, reminding all who look upon it of the resilience of humanity and the power of unity in the face of darkness.

content.title: Kai Wing Woods
paragraphs: To the east of Durlan lies the Kai Wing Woods, a woodland forest known for its dense vegetation, even though its trees may not reach the towering heights of the Night Chaser Forest. The forest derives its name from being the predominant home of the Kai Wing population in Edenfell. Within its boundaries, the Kai Wing Woods boasts an abundance of Golden Berry and Lantern Cherry trees, which contribute to the forest's vibrant atmosphere. Additionally, the woodland is characterized by numerous bodies of water, including creeks, streams, and small springs and pools. It is believed that the presence of these water sources is a significant factor in why the untamable Kai Wings have chosen this forest as their habitat. The Kai Wings have a deep affection for the fish that can still be found in the waters, despite the encroaching corruption that threatens the forest from the north and east.

content.title: Night Chasers
paragraphs: The Night Chaser Forest is a breathtaking place filled with emerald trees and a magical atmosphere. As you go deeper into the forest, you'll see towering ancient trees that create a beautiful canopy, allowing only a little sunlight to reach the ground. The filtered sunlight creates a mesmerizing display of light and shadow, making the surroundings shine in shades of green and gold. In this vibrant forest, there's a symphony of life. Colorful plants cover the forest floor, filling the air with delightful scents. Moss-covered rocks and twisted roots seem to have stories to tell about the forest's mysterious origins. The forest is home to both ordinary and extraordinary animals, including elusive creatures called Chasers that dart between the trees, captivating anyone lucky enough to see them.

The Night Chaser Forest is a paradise for gatherers and hunters. People who understand the forest's secrets venture forth with baskets and bags to collect the treasures of nature. Delicious wild berries with a perfect balance of sweetness and tartness burst with flavor, and glowing mushrooms entice the curious to explore their hidden world. Skilled hunters, armed with ancient knowledge, move silently through the forest, blending in with the wilderness as they seek elusive game or valuable Chasers. However, even in the beauty of the Night Chaser Forest, there is a sense of danger in the northeastern part. People share scary stories of darkness, horror, and fear. Many feel uneasy, catching glimpses of frightening creatures called Voidbringers. It's a region where caution is necessary, and even the bravest adventurers proceed with wariness.

content.title: New Frontier
paragraphs: The New Frontier, an uncharted continent lying to the east of Edenfell, has recently piqued the interest of explorers and groups such as the Lorechasers and the United Army (UnA). While still largely unexplored, initial ventures into the continent have revealed a lack of overwhelming Voidbringer presence, sparking growing curiosity and excitement among those seeking new knowledge and opportunities. As Lorechasers delve deeper into the uncharted lands and the UnA ensures the safety of expeditions, the New Frontier becomes a symbol of untapped potential, offering a fresh canvas for discovery and exploration beyond the known boundaries of Edenfell.

content.title: No Man's Land
paragraphs: No Man's Land is one of Edenfell’s floating islands, perpetually spinning in place hundreds of feet above the ocean on which it once sat. It is a desolate place forsaken by hope and hopelessly overrun by Voidborn that stands as a haunting testament to the ruins of the old world. Buried within its broken soil, remnants of once-great civilizations lie entombed, their glory reduced to shattered fragments. Jagged crevices and upheaved terrain bear witness to the Cataclysm's destructive power.

On this forsaken island, an ethereal mist hangs heavy, obscuring vision and distorting sounds. Nature's forces clash in ceaseless turmoil, flooding the broken landscape with relentless fury. Barren and lifeless, the skeletal remains of trees reach for a sun obscured by dense fog. Stagnant waters, tainted by the corruption carried by the Voidbringers, exude a noxious miasma.
No Man's Land stands as a testament to the transience of human endeavors and the fragility of existence. Amidst the ruins and draining life force, a profound sense of tragedy lingers.

content.title: Obscuron
paragraphs: Obscuron is a desolate and nightmarish place that is the epitome of devastation and despair. It is the haunting Ground Zero of the Cataclysm, the apocalyptic event triggered by Nimiane's fateful actions that shattered the world and fused the realms of Edenfell and Limbo, an unknown, malevolent dimension. The consequences of this event transformed Obscuron into a place devoid of life and brimming with constant peril. Poisonous cascading waterfalls are frozen in time, while the very air itself erodes life and stifles the flow of magic. The plants within this forsaken land are trapped in eternal decay, driven to feed on any remaining traces of life, much like the hordes of mindless Voidbringers that roam the continent and its grotesque floating islands, akin to relentless undead zombies.

At the heart of Obscuron stands Fëanor's Peak, a foreboding mountain that serves as a grim reminder of the horrors that befell the old world. It is here that King Fëanor, the lone survivor of an unsuccessful expedition, emerged from Limbo, returning to Edenfell as a witness to the devastation that consumed his companions. Obscuron isn’t just in the danger zone, it is the danger zone. Wandering into this place is foolishness that spells nothing but an imminent and agonizing end.

content.title: The Nest Lands
paragraphs: The Nest Lands is a remarkable collection of floating islands, suspended high above the ocean and untouched by the influence of the Voidborn. These islands serve as the ideal habitat for the White Wings, majestic creatures that build their nests within the ground. Located hundreds of feet above the water, the Nest Lands presents a breathtaking sight and an environment that is, like other floating islands, often only accessible to mages and individuals capable of flight.

Despite the challenges of reaching the Nest Lands, these islands attract a steady stream of adventurers, daredevils, and expeditions each year. The allure of exploring this unique and unspoiled realm, coupled with the opportunity to witness the graceful flight and nesting habits of the White Wings, draws people from far and wide. The Nest Lands offer a sense of wonder and an escape from the dangers and corruption that plague other parts of Edenfell, making it a coveted destination for those seeking adventure and the chance to witness the marvels of nature in a truly extraordinary setting.

The manifestation of magic is called Weaving. There exists an unseen infinite magical force leaking into all the realms, referred to as the Loom, that is the very fabric of divinity. Magical creatures and individuals are capable of sensing the Loom and (sometimes with brief training) can reach out, grab and shape this fabric of magic, thus Weaving. Mages and wielders of magic are called Magic Sensitives or Weavers.

Mages can interact with and manipulate the Loom using Mana, the ether that connects them to the Loom, acting as a bridge between the physical world and this higher realm of the divine. Depending on how much Mana they possess, Mages are acutely aware of the Loom and can feel the magic around them from the day they are born.

The amount of Mana a mage has access to determines how much of the Loom they can tap into and wield, i.e. their magic capacity. This is reflected in the number and magnitude of Spells a mage can cast at full strength.

content.title: Spell Weaving and Blood
paragraphs: Spells are magic in action. Spell weaving is the act of creating and casting a magical effect and is basically a blanket term for the expression of magic. The number and power of spells a mage has in their arsenal are determined by the amount of Mana flowing through them. Players earn spell slots as they gain experience per Tier. Spell slots represent the potential individual spell capacity a mage has. They can either be used to cast a single spell each or combined to cast a spell worth several slots and therefore far greater in power, albeit more expensive to use.

Each player has access to a limited amount of Mana represented by a limited number of spells (spell slots) determined by their rank as already mentioned. Weaving more powerful spells means consuming more Mana (i.e. combining and using up available spell slots) per scene and therefore potentially running out before the scene is over, but it could also mean dealing a more potent or fatal blow to an obstacle or enemy sooner than later.

Mana resets in each new scene but it can also be replenished using Blood. Because Mana flows through mages and magical creatures in the same way blood does, it is found entwined with the substance and is, therefore, part of their lifeblood. Consuming one’s own blood or blood from another who possesses magic will replenish a mage’s Mana by 50% flat, no matter how much is consumed (so it would be wise not to bleed yourself dry). Blood can only be used once per scene (unless otherwise stated) so be prudent with how you choose to use it.

content.title: Tiers (the numbers business no one likes)
paragraphs: Spells are magic in action. Spell weaving is the act of creating and casting a magical effect and is basically a blanket term for the expression of magic. The number and power of spells a mage has in their arsenal are determined by the amount of Mana flowing through them. Players earn spell slots as they gain experience per Tier. Spell slots represent the potential individual spell capacity a mage has. They can either be used to cast a single spell each or combined to cast a spell worth several slots and therefore far greater in power, albeit more expensive to use.

content.text: Relative Peak Output (scale, speed, weight, destructive power, poison action)
Mountain, Mikoyan MiG-25, freight train (4000T), Little Boy Uranium 235 warhead, 1 turn to 3 turns
City, Lockheed F-117 Nighthawk, Cargo Ship (1000T), Massive Ordnance Air Blast (MOAB), 3 turns to 6 turns
Small Town, Commercial Plane, House (156T), Boeing B-29 Superfortress, 6 turns to 9 turns
Skyscraper, Ferrari FXX Evo, Tank (55T), NLAW Anti-Tank Weapon, 9 turns to 12 turns
Large Building, Cheetah, Large Car (2T-3T), RPG-7, 12 turns to 15 turns
Small Building, Gazelle, Compact Car (1T), Hand Grenade, 15 turns to 20 turns

paragraphs.text: Non-magical feats will not exceed the Initiate level (and Acolyte level for Nords).

paragraphs: Players will earn 150-200 EXP per scene with the exception of particularly great scenes that may break this barrier by a margin up to the Moderators’ discretion. Events or quests can fetch upwards of 400 EXP and so players should endeavor to participate in as many as they can as often as possible. A new spell will be earned every 1000 EXP.

Players are expected to mention, in parentheses (for the sake of other players and DMs), how much Mana (Spell slots) has been consumed by them per turn in which magic is cast by their character, e.g. -

paragraphs.text: A myriad of embers materialized out of thin air around the Wizard, quickly expanding in shape and size until each grew into a singular, massive house-sized fireball big enough to blot out the sun in the sky. Slowly, guided by his rising hand, the blazing orb flew up and replaced the sun's warm illumination with its blinding luminosity and raging heat. 'You've yee'd your last haw, pardner.' With a languid fall of his hand, the conflagration spread into a thousand fist-sized orbs which fell onto the field in front of him, whizzing down at a blinding speed, each flaming sphere acting with the singular purpose to seek, burn and destroy. [fireball power: 12 spells]

paragraphs: Every mage has unique quirks and mannerisms when wielding magic that make each individual fun and interesting. It might be a particular set of hand signs, the use of outspoken words when Spell Weaving, or even the redundant use of a wand or staff.
These idiosyncrasies often help the mages focus as they Weave powerful magic out of the Loom around them and are therefore referred to as a mage’s Spell Focus (Spell Foci plural).

Furthermore, whenever magic is cast by a mage in Edenfell the effect is accompanied by a magic circle that may appear either as a luminescent ring of patterns around their hands or on whatever surface is being affected by or subjected to the magic.

Magic circles are unique to each mage and no two patterns + color combinations are ever the same, so players are encouraged to have fun finding interesting and distinct colors and patterns for their characters’ magic circles.
Spell Foci and Magic Circles are entirely narrative.

content.title: The Schools of Magic
paragraphs: The manifestation of magic is called Weaving. There exists an unseen infinite magical force leaking into all the realms, referred to as the Loom, that is the very fabric of divinity. Magical creatures and individuals are capable of sensing the Loom and (sometimes with brief training) can reach out, grab and shape this fabric of magic, thus Weaving. Mages and wielders of magic are called Magic Sensitives or Weavers.

content.title: Evocation
paragraphs: This is the magic of the Elves. Evocation magic allows the Elves to create or manipulate the elements and their various states or forces to wonderful effect. The elements of Evocation are water, earth, fire, lightning, tallow & air.

The best Elven mages can freely switch between elements with ease and equal mastery, but most mages specialize in an element most natural to them. Tallow is the term used for all liquids (and frozen states) that are not water.

content.title: Enchantment

paragraphs.text: This is Fae magic. It grants Faes the power to temporarily wield and manipulate the

and insects of Edenfell. While now unable to effect permanent changes on most plants, Fae mages are still able to make long-lasting effects that survive the duration of a scene and they may even ‘conjure’ impermanent but powerful plants and bugs from nothing that appear as green constructs and do their bidding.

paragraphs: Faes possess the unique ability to enchant other mages too, supplementing (or siphoning) their mana on contact (skin-to-skin) by 50% of its full capacity.

content.title: Conjuration
paragraphs: This magic allows Nords to create hard light constructs whose size, shape, power, effects, and strength depend on the mage’s Tier and mana alone. Conjuration (also called Crafting) is hailed often because of the creative freedom it grants the mages, limiting them to the extent of the imagination and nothing else.

Conjuration mages are unable to cast magic in the absence of a proper light source, therefore it is not uncommon to find them carrying candles, torches, or lamps when they must venture into the darkness.

paragraphs.text: Changelings use alteration to transform into all the

. They are able to combine forms (up to three) and create chimeras, borrowing the desired traits and physiologies of the beasts they choose. At the highest levels (Adeptus+), Changeling mages can become mythical beasts of their own creation and imagination, taking their threat and power to new and exciting dimensions.

content.title: Organics Rule
paragraphs: Mana is strongest in the body. The natural flow stops any attempt at controlling or manipulating something that is part of a living being. External magic cannot enter the body either unless willed by both parties. Don’t go trying to blood-bend other players or blow them up from the inside out, we do not enjoy these techniques, and as such our magic system doesn’t allow it. Don’t be a loser.

content.title: Relics Rule
paragraphs: Relics are specially crafted items which have permanent magical effects outside of the normal schools of magic due to runic magic, limited only by the moderators’ discretion. They are made with runic magic which is now almost extinct, which makes them both rare and costly. A relic of a particular rank costs half the EXP to go from the previous rank to that rank, and the spent EXP cannot be taken back.

content.title: Mages v/s Non-Mages: What's the Difference?
paragraphs: Mages are magic-sensitive individuals capable of bending the Loom to their will and teeming with the mana with which to do so. Non-mages do not have enough mana to tap into the supernatural force and therefore do not manifest any abilities beyond Traits inherent in their race.

Magic was once commonplace in Edenfell and it was almost strange to find a person who was not magic-sensitive enough to effect even the smallest of magic if they tried. Since the Cataclysm, however, most magic has been taken from the world and mages make up the smallest demographic in Edenfell. They are considered rare “mutants” capable of extraordinary gifts and can often be visibly told apart from those who have not been affected by this mystical mutation.

Mages experience physical side effects to their attunement with the Loom that make them physiologically different in slight or sometimes drastic ways from the rest of their race. They are often several heads taller (and usually rangy) than others and might develop or be born with strange features like an extra finger, unusual color eyes, peculiar hair or facial features, and in the most extreme cases, an extra organ in a body larger than it should normally be as a result of this. These side effects are mostly narrative, though they may provide meager advantages here and there, it is best to get these approved by moderators either during initial character approval or later if a player wishes for their character to develop abnormalities along the line.

Only non-mages are capable of taming magical beasts (especially dragons) in Edenfell since the Cataclysm, a drastic change from the way the world once was. This is thought to be a result of a now inherent animosity and distrust harbored by Edenfell’s magical beasts towards mages and magic as they are to blame for the apocalypse that befell the world. Non-mages start at the same rank as mages do (Initiate) and may come into ownership of magic beasts appropriate for their level as they rank up, getting a new pet every TWO Tiers. Magic beasts start at their given Tiers and rank up as their owners do, unlocking spell slots just as mages do.

content.title: Adam's Steel
paragraphs: Adam Forged Steel (also called Adam's Iron or Adam's Steel) is a form of metal that was forged in the days of the first men, long before the Alfen and the Anthros of Edenfell. When fashioned into bladed weapons, the steel can hold an especially keen edge, remaining sharp forever without the need for honing.

Aside from its sharpness, Adam's Iron is recognizable by its strength and light weight in comparison to ordinary steel, as well as by a distinctive rippled pattern visible in blades made from it. Adam Forged Steel is one of the few known substances that can completely repel magic and its effects. It is the only form of the Abjuration school magic in Edenfell.

Unlike regular steel from which weapons and shields are fashioned, the rare Adam's Steel is capable of blocking all forms of spells and mystic arts because it can match them and grow in Abjuration power that sometimes even exceeds that of the mages it is wielded against. When well-aimed (head, torso, and limbs), Adam's Steel can negate an individual's sorcery by cutting off their essential mana flow and keep it that way for as long as the sword is buried in there. Wounds inflicted by this metal cannot be magically healed.
No one knows the source or origin of this mysterious and powerful metal, but its usefulness since the dawn of the ages is undeniable.

The secret of forging Adam's Iron is unknown, making the creation of new weapons impossible. The material is expensive and difficult to obtain. Skilled smiths can reforge Adam Forged Steel weapons by melting down existing ones, but it's a difficult process. Two smaller Adam's Iron swords can be made out of a larger greatsword, or a large greatsword made by melting down multiple smaller swords, but the amount of Adam Forged Steel in the world is finite and extremely rare. The majority of the surviving Adan's Steel weapons either serve as heirlooms in the various noble houses of Edenfell, can be purchased at outrageous prices from few merchants, or are in the possession of the United Army.

Tuning is a phenomenon that occurs when a character has had their Adam’s Steel equipment for long enough that they form a bond or connection with it beyond what is normal. Characters may tune with their weapon three times, once every two Tiers. There are three tunings possible:

paragraphs.text: It allows the character to manipulate their weapon telekinetically through their bond within a range suitable for the character’s Tier.
It allows the character to freely manipulate and change the shape of their weapon.
It allows the character to create and wield a second version of their weapon that lasts an appropriate amount of turns for their Tier per scene.

paragraphs: When a wielder brandishes their claimed Adam’s Steel sword (specifically), the arm that holds the weapon ripples with magic and takes on a steely appearance similar to their weapon’s blade. This singular limb becomes impervious to the effects of magic at the weapon’s Tier and the effects of Adam’s Steel blades.

Wielding Adam's Steel also provides enhanced physical attributes at the level of the weapon’s current Tier, such that soldiers who primarily wield these weapons can perform extraordinary feats and pose a significant threat to their magically gifted and powerful enemies.

Adam’s Steel weapons are imbued with a fragment of the souls of magical beings (mages, beasts, or Voidborn) they slay or participate in the slaying of. Slowly, this builds up until eventually there is an eerie howling when a much-experienced blade is summoned, the souls trapped in the steel announcing its fatality. As a result of this, the highest-ranked wielders of these weapons—those with the greatest kill counts—are called Deathsingers.

content.title: Fame and Infamy
paragraphs: Fame and Infamy are narrative identifiers that will be used to add flavor to the roleplay, just like foci and Magic Circles. A character's Fame or Infamy is an indicator of how well-known they are in the world of the roleplay and determines if other characters would have heard of them and their deeds or legend without necessarily ever having met them.

Players will earn Fame and Infamy in a similar way as they do Exp but only by partaking in important events or scenes that are deemed exceedingly relevant by a DM. Basically, if it makes sense in canon that a character will gain renown or notoriety from an action or course of action, the Fame and Infamy system will ensure that they do.
This is a way to encourage you to go ahead and become a legend; we will make sure everyone knows about you.
For the good guys:

content.text: You are a Savior of this world.
The people know you and they love you.

paragraphs: For the more sinister fellows:

content.text: The people are terrified of you.

paragraphs: Players will earn 100-150 points per relevant event/deed but in the case of exceptionally salient events, they may also earn substantially more
